pageTitle: Itinerary for Friday, June 15, 2018 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Ottawa, Ontario

8:30 a.m. The Prime Minister, along with the Minister of Foreign Affairs Chrystia Freeland, the Minister of International Trade François-Philippe Champagne, the Minister of Environment and Climate Change Catherine McKenna, and the Minister of Democratic Institutions Karina Gould, will meet with the Prime Minister’s Youth Council.

Closed to media

1:00 p.m. The Prime Minister, along with the Minister of Crown-Indigenous Relations and Northern Affairs, Carolyn Bennett, the Minister of Indigenous Services, Jane Philpott, the Minister of Health, Ginette Petitpas Taylor, the Minister of Families, Children and Social Development, Jean-Yves Duclos, and the Minister of Employment, Workforce Development and Labour, Patricia Hajdu, will attend the Métis National Council-Crown Summit.

237-C, Centre Block
Parliament Hill

Note for media:

    • Photo opportunity at the beginning of the meeting

Media appearances

7:30 a.m. An interview with the Prime Minister will air on KYK Radio X.

8:00 a.m. An interview with the Prime Minister will air on CKAJ FM.
